alert.note: Alert for Northeastern Brooks Range (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 09 at 6:11AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by heavy rainfall is occuring or expected. * WHERE...Anaktuvuk, Nanushuk, Itkillik, Kuparuk, Atigun and Sagavanirktok Rivers. * WHEN...Until 600 AM AKDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 555 AM AKDT Sunday, river gauge reports on the Sagavanirktok and Atigun Rivers indicate that flooding is occuring on those rivers. Flooding is likely along the Anaktuvuk, Nanushuk, Itkillik, Kuparuk Rivers as they have similar headwaters to the Atigun and Sagavanirtok Rivers. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain fell between Atigun Pass and Sagwon from Friday night through Saturday night. - The Atigun River appears to have the highest summer water level on record, and flooding is expected along the Atigun River today. The Sagavanirktok River Gauge near Pump Station 3 is rising rapidly and indicates that flooding is occuring now and that moderate flooding is possible. This high water could threaten the Dalton Highway in areas where the highway runs along the Sagavanirtok River. High water will peak out near Pump station 3 about noon today, with the crest moving downriver later today and Monday. - For Sagavanirktok River near Pump Station 3: At 5:15am the stage was 21.51 feet. Flood Stage is 20.0 feet. Forecast: A crest around 22.0 feet is expected around noon Sunday. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
